summary.name: VOGUE Supply Chain Manifest
summary.description: An in-depth look at the print publication supply network; includes paper mills, printing sites, ink producer, retail, and distribution nodes

overview.name: VOGUE Headquaters
overview.description: VOGUE Headquarters, where the final drafts of the print publication are edited and approved before being sent to print. Once sent off to print, Quad/Graphics becomes responsible for handling both print and distribution related tasks.

location.address: One World Trade Center; New York, NY 10007

overview.name: Conde Nast Headquarters
overview.description: Conde Nast is the owner of VOGUE magazine and a multitude of other print publications. Their partnership with Quad/Graphics means that they are responsible for design related tasks prior to printing and distribution of each of their magazines.

location.address: One World Trade Center; New York, NY 10007

overview.name: Quad/Graphics International Headquarters
overview.description: Quad or Quad/Graphics is the company responsible for both printing and distributing copies of VOGUE magazine, along with all other Conde Nast products. This means they have an extensive, international network that includes corporate offices, manufacturing, printing, and distribution sites. This location in Wisconsin is known as their International Headquarters.

location.address: N61 W23044 Harry's Way, Sussex, WI 53089

overview.name: Quad/Graphics NYC Corporate Office
overview.description: Quad or Quad/Graphics is the company responsible for both printing and distributing copies of VOGUE magazine, along with all other Conde Nast products. This means they have an extensive, international network that includes corporate offices, manufacturing, printing, and distribution sites. This location in NYC acts as a corporate office and most likely allows for smooth,accessible communication with Conde Nast, VOGUE, and their other print publications that are based in NYC.

overview.name: Quad/Graphics Printing Site (Saratoga Springs)
overview.description: Quad or Quad/Graphics is the company responsible for both printing and distributing copies of VOGUE magazine, along with all other Conde Nast products. This means they have an extensive, international network that includes corporate offices, manufacturing, printing, and distribution sites. This location in Saratoga Springs is a plant most likely involved in printing production and could be responsible for supplying NYC retailers.

overview.name: Quad/Graphics Printing Site (Westampton)
overview.description: Quad or Quad/Graphics is the company responsible for both printing and distributing copies of VOGUE magazine, along with all other Conde Nast products. This means they have an extensive, international network that includes corporate offices, manufacturing, printing, and distribution sites. This location in Westampton is a plant most likely involved in printing production and could be responsible for supplying NYC retailers.

overview.name: Mesta Board Headquarters
overview.description: Mesta Board paper mills are responsible for producing paper rolls from wood pulp and supplying it to Quad/ Graphics for printing. These mills are located throughout both Finland and Sweden where there is a strong forestry industry and sustainable growing techniques are more regularly practiced. They are known to produce Galerie Fine coated paper, which is the kind specifically cited as being used by VOGUE since at least the late 80's.

overview.name: Mesta Board Paper Mill (Husum)
overview.description: Mesta Board paper mills are responsible for producing paper rolls from wood pulp and supplying it to Quad/ Graphics for printing. These mills are located throughout both Finland and Sweden where there is a strong forestry industry and sustainable growing techniques are more regularly practiced. *Note: This mill in Husum specifically produces wood pulp that is then used across all the other mills to make paper products

overview.name: Mesta Board Paper Mill (Kemi)
overview.description: Mesta Board paper mills are responsible for producing paper rolls from wood pulp and supplying it to Quad/ Graphics for printing. These mills are located throughout both Finland and Sweden where there is a strong forestry industry and sustainable growing techniques are more regularly practiced.

overview.name: Sveaskog
overview.description: Sveaskog is a Swedish timber, wood fibre supplier, who most likely acts as one of Mesta Group's vendors. They are responsible for sustainably growing and harvesting timber throughout Sweden before sending it to Mesta Group's mills to be turned to pulp and ultimately paper.

overview.name: CR/T : Division of Quad/Graphics
overview.description: CR/T is the division of Quad responsible for ink production. EniroTech ink is said to be used for VOGUE products due to the company's pursuit of sustainability. This kind of ink normally made up of two main ingredients: vegetable oil (normally linseed and/or soybean) and pine resins, which are supplied by other companies (most likely in North America) before being produced into the ink used throughout Quad's franchise. Operating Facilities: Lomira, WI; Oklahoma City, OK; Martinsburg, WV; Greenfield, IA; Hartford, WI; Wyszk√≥w, Poland

sources.source: CR/T, A Division Of Quad Graphics | Ink World

overview.name: Cargill                                                    (Protein Processing Plant)
overview.description: Cargill is a potential ink material supplier for Quad/Graphics, specifically their specialty linseed and/or soybean oils. These types of oils are said to be one of the main ingredients in more environmentally friendly/ petroleum-free printing inks. Because Quad and VOGUE list their printing inks as environmentally friendly, we can assume these materials are used during ink production. This is one of thousands of Cargill's global locations (but was chosen because of its protein processing capablities and its vicinity to Quad Headquarters).

overview.name: Florachem                               (Pine Oil/Resin Supplier)
overview.description: Florachem is a potential ink material supplier, specificallyof pine oil and resin. This is one of the mainingredients used in environmentally friendly printing inks. Like Quad, VOGUE has listed their mission to sustainability and improving the environmental impact of the printing industry.

overview.name: GDI Adhesives
overview.description: GDI Adhesives is a potential supplier of hot melt adhesives, which are typically used for the "perfect binding" techniques found in VOGUE magazines. This specific location is near Quad/Graphics HQ and its subsidiary factories.

overview.name: We Energies
overview.description: We Energies is most likely the electric company used by Quad Headquarters. Energy was listed by Quad as one of their top 3 raw materials, due to the amount of electricity used by their equipment during the printing process. (Quad has listed some of their sustainbility goals and could begin to rely on the area's hydro-electirc power to fuel their plants.)

location.address: W240 N2989 Pewaukee Rd, Pewaukee, WI 53072

overview.name: Sussex Water Utility
overview.description: Sussex Water Utility is most likely the water utility company that provides for Quad Headquarters. Water is a necessary element used during the offset printing process in order to cool heatset ink, meaning the company(along with other water suppliers) is integral to the eventual production of Quad's print publications and VOGUE magazine.

location.address: N64 W23760 Main St, Sussex, WI 53089

overview.name: Duplainville Transport
overview.description: Duplainville Transport is a Quad subsidiary responsible for distribution and freight. They are listed as a SmartWay partner by the EPA, which relates to their frieght and trucking practices and the resulting impact on the environment. They are a small piece in a vast distribution network headed by Quad/Graphics, but would typically be used for delivering to and from their International Headquarters in Wisconsin.

location.address: N63 W23075 Highway 74 , Sussex, Wisconsin, United States

overview.name: Barnes & Noble                         (Fifth Ave)
overview.description: Barnes & Noble is an example of a national/ large chain retailer known for carrying the product in store. This is one of their local locations, but others can be found across the counrty.

overview.name: Magazine Cafe
overview.description: Magazine Cafe is an example of a local retailer who is known for carrying the product in store.

overview.name: Iconic Magazine
overview.description: Iconic Magazines is an example of a local retailer who is known for carrying the product in store.
